definition: to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: The bad behaviour of his bachelor brother continued unabated.
sentences.chinese: 那个仍是单身的兄弟，将继续他的不良操行。

sentences.english: The evaluation of conduct involves some amount of generalization.
sentences.chinese: 对操行的评价会含有一些泛泛之论。

sentences.english: Li Baiyao, the well-known courtier at the early stage of Tang Dynasty, was famous for his talents and virtue.
sentences.chinese: 李百药是唐初名巨，以才学和操行闻名于世。

sentences.english: At present the factory is run by a young man in his thirties.
sentences.chinese: 工厂在他的三十内当前由一个年轻人负责操行。

sentences.english: She has received a written warning about her conduct.
sentences.chinese: 她已接获对她操行的书面警告。

sentences.english: Doing this simplifies the code needed to inspect the results of the service invocation.
sentences.chinese: 执行此操行会简化检查服务调用结果所需的代码。

sentences.english: Ambition is the germ from which all growth of nobleness proceeds.
sentences.chinese: 抱负是一切高尚操行的萌芽。

sentences.english: Conduct grade over 70 in your current semester.
sentences.chinese: 本学期操行成绩须在七十分以上。

definition: sense of propriety, justice, integrity and honor (i.e. the four social bonds, 四維|四维[si4 wei2])
conduct and learning (of an individual)/moral nature and skill
to serve as a model for others (idiom)/to be a worthy teacher
(dialect) no good/(contraction of 不 and 好)/see 孬種|孬种[nao1 zhong3]
noble and virtuous/aloof from politics and material pursuits
